text: I have a really simple recipe for you
and it's using roasted garlic which I
think if you're not already doing at
home you should learn this great
technique because roasted garlic is so
great on so many things today it's going
on penny
tomorrow maybe on a sandwich so to make
roast garlic pre-heat your oven to 400
degrees and then cut off the tops of as
many garlic cloves as you want you can
make bunch of these and then keep them
in the refrigerator squeeze them out of
their skin put them in a jar
so they last a while in the fridge
especially if you cover them with a
little bit of olive oil to just cut the
tops off I'm doing three because that's
how many I actually need for this recipe
if you can believe it put your garlic on
a piece of parchment lined aluminum foil
and then I'm going to add a little bit
of thyme you could add some rosemary if
you wanted to drizzle with a little bit
of olive oil or a lot if you're me and
then wrap it up you want to make a nice
environment for the garlic to roast but
not overly rose so keep it nice and
contained that'll contain some of the
moisture in there and it won't dry out
too take about one hour in a 400 degree
oven when your garlic is done it should
be nice and soft and really easy to
squeeze out of the skins and golden
brown but not black sometimes if you
forget about it I'm not saying you're
going to but I've done it before it gets
all black and acrid tasting and gross
instead of delicious and sweet which is
what roasted garlic should taste like
take your garlic and then just squeeze
them out of the skin you can just
squeeze one by one if you don't like
smelling like garlic you might want to
wear a pair of gloves see I just can't
do it I'm not patient enough this is
making quite a pile of garlic I'd say
that the total for these three heads is
probably about two and a half
tablespoons or something like that which
is a good amount
like I said make some more because this
is so good on so many things
really just brings garlic to a whole new
level I'm sure you know what I'm talking
about
it's like eating something completely
different you can mix it with no it's
really good mix it with a little bit of
soft butter Oh put it on sandwiches okay
there we go make sure that before your
garlic finishes you boil some water and
cook some penne I have 3/4 of a pound of
penne save some pasta water about 3/4 of
a cup before you drain and then drain
your pasta obviously you can use any
shape pasta you want I like the short
pastas for this but it doesn't have to
be penne
pastas drained make the sauce take 3/4
of a cup of the pasta water
take your squeezed out garlic you know
what I'm gonna amend what I said earlier
this looks more like almost a quarter of
a cup if your garlic heads are
particularly big you might only need to
stir that into your pasta water this is
making a really nice sauce I kind of
want to make this nice and creamy so I'm
really wishing it up and if there are
pieces that won't much like these sort
of darker pieces you can remove those if
you want to add 1/2 a cup of grated
pecorino romano or parm if you want to
and two tablespoons of heavy cream this
adds richness and delightfulness to the
sauce bring it up to a boil and then
stir in your pasta the cream helps
thickening as well as the starch that
was in the pasta water pasta goes in
stir it up you can actually turn it off
now you don't want to over reduce your
sauce but this will be a nice light
coating of sauce but it's going to be
really really flavorful because well
it's mostly roasted garlic and that has
tons of flavor season it with some salt
and you're in time just to lighten this
up a little bit or add some freshness
you can put some greens on top I have
some of these little sprouts you can use
watercress or any kind of green really
that appeals to you starve it up put
some of those greens on top just for a
little bit of lightness and freshness
and dig in you are going to love it it's
full of amazing sweet garlic enos mmm
really are
